alert.note: Alert for Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 1:51PM EST until February 19 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Grand River At Painesville affecting Lake County. For the Grand River...including Painesville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River At Painesville. * WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 8.3 feet. - An ice jam has been reported in Fairport Harbor with reports of the river out of its banks. River levels and flooding impacts may differ near the mouth of the river from the gage location in Painesville. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 02/06/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1145 PM EST.
